summary:
Originally a self-taught designer whose craving for new tools to master lead me full circle back to a childhood interest: coding. The web standards movement of the mid-2000s presented me with the perfect opportunity to meld my proven design chops with my rediscovered coding passion and to fill void that the death of the Flash platform left for design agencies attempting to create rich web experiences. I quickly took over all website development at the advertising agencies I freelanced at, which provided a steady stream of client websites to build with ever-increasing feature complexity. I loved the constant learning necessary to be able to provide, in effect, a turnkey digital solution for agencies that otherwise couldn't offer professional web services to their clients.

If I had to choose my most valuable and defining feature it would be my ability and drive to learn.

My very minor “internet fame” comes from developing the ubiquitous Superfish dropdown menu plugin during the early days of jQuery’s birth.

experience.description:
Consultation and freelance contracts developing and maintaining WordPress/WooCommerce and Laravel websites for Balance Marketing. Websites for NT Tourism’s “Million Dollar Fish” competition, Ted’s Cameras, DAF ”Do the Math” campaign, Laurent Bakery, transactional email templates for Melbourne Airport Parking), ARL brands (Sportspower, Camping World, Compleat Angler and Nitro Rods).

Gatsby/React-based statically generated websites for Fortis Development Group based on mockups with precise grid-based design and “Headless” WordPress for CMS.

Contract Sass development for San Fransisco-based web app startup Applauze.

Continued development of Open Source dropdown menu jQuery plugin “Superfish” and WordPress plugin NoFollowr.

VueJS side projects.

experience.company: Grant Day James and Hubink (design and advertising agencies)
experience.description:
Sole web developer for all GDJ and Hubink web clients. Designed, developed and maintained the high-traffic Hamish & Andy website for 7 years. Devised, designed and developed other major web properties for Australia Post, Strathcona Grammar School, Children First Foundation, Fendt, Massey Ferguson, Patagonia Australia, Great Golf Courses of Australia and Nike.

Using Agile and test-driven processes, I teamed with developers from ThoughtWorks to build “MyAdbox” web app, around which a separate business was formed and continues to thrive today (see myadbox.com). I designed and developed the user-facing interface for (initially) Volkswagen dealerships to use, allowing them to quickly create and publish print advertisements from adaptive InDesign templates which I created to match their style guide specifications, regardless of the media space it filled. I handled all UI design and front-end development in addition to researching and implementing the InDesign Server scripting engine that formed the heart of the functionality.

projects.name: Gatsby resume starter
projects.description: Gatsby resume tailwind is a free starter template with  Netlify CMS implementation. It is easy to customize the design with thanks to tailwind theming capabilities. It uses git as a backend and can be deployed to any static hosting service like Netlify, firebase hosting or Github pages.
